reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have never been to Jamaica, so after many reviews and research I decided that Secrets St James is the place for us. We booked thru Expedia and arranged the transportation thru Jamaica Tours (thru expedia)...everything worked out perfect. It was a seamless transport from the airport to the resort (we had a Junior Gulf View Suite). The best thing about the resort is the STAFF, and beautiful turquoise water...everyone is so friendly and nice. The resort is very nice, AMAZING comfortable beds, lots of bars and restaurants to choose from...in regards to the food HIMITSU is the best restaurant there (I will give you a detailed description of each place and must try's below. Also honest reviews of everything...I normally stay at 5 star resorts...so I will be honest to you on what is good/not so good and a detailed review of each item there.
reviews.title: Great Honeymoon!!! :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For Breakfast we got a free champagne breakfast for our Honeymoon so that was awesome (you can arrange it in advance).. :) we had it our first full day there and it was wonderful on the balcony. There is only room service or World Cafe for Breakfast options...it's a breakfast buffet and is WONDERFUL!! Must haves (Omelette station, French Toast Brulee)...DONT MISS EITHER, we didn't discover this until the 3rd or 4th day...For lunch there is 3 choices...World Cafe Buffet (DONT MISS THE PASTA BAR), Oceana and Seaside Grill...Oceana has wraps that you build your own..they are "ok"..and at Seaside Grill..honestly we didn't like the food...we went to the World Cafe Buffet the rest of the trip for lunch and it was wonderful! :)
reviews.title: Best resort ever!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For Dinner Options...
reviews.title: Our first visit to a Secrets, got there just after hurricane Sandy had left.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012
reviews.text: Himitsu (Our favorite place...we did the Teppanyaki twice)- make your reservations in advance..Rooster was our chef and he was awesome! :) We also ate in the normal restaurant there..and the pad thai is awesome! :)
reviews.title: Fabulous cmvacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Bordeaux- the french restaurant...the grouper with hollandaise is a MUST have! Delish! :)
reviews.title: 2nd Trip To Secrets This Year!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I got back a week and a half ago from Secrets St. James. We had a blast!! Donna @ the Marlin Bar was AMAZING!! She was so nice and made us feel so welcome. My husband loved the Lemon Slushes and I loved the Purple Rain & Bob Marley drinks from the bar. Jobe, the lifeguard, is a great guy too. We didn't need any rescuing from the pool/ocean, but he was always walking around and making sure everything was going well for us.
reviews.title: Terrific Honeymoon!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ziplining at Chukka was worth every penny!! There were 7 different ziplines and every one of them was a blast (remember lots of bug spray). The tour guides were terrific too, they were cracking jokes and having just as much fun as we were. Eat before you go because it is about a 3 hour trip, with hiking in between the ziplines (they do have food and drink you can get afterwards).
reviews.title: Honeymoon Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The Dunn's River Falls was a good time too (bring water shoes or buy them from the giftshop so you don't have to rent them). The trip out there was a lot longer 2 hrs vs. 45 mins (the bus driver going to Chukka was better than the one going to the Dunn's River Falls too). It was cool to see how different the country side was from the city of Montego Bay. Climbing the waterfall was a lot of fun!! When you get done you will have to leave through a little market place area. Just put your hands in your pockets and don't make eye contact (then they won't try to hustle you or try to put things in your hands. And don't tell them your name in there either!). It was well worth the trip to climb the waterfall too!!
reviews.title: Best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are kind of picky eaters, but the Jerked Chicken from the push carts was AMAZING!! We were a little leery at first, but it was so worth it (and included as all-inclusive). We also loved the Italian place. We ate there twice (probably would have at least one more time but we didn't venture there until 3 nights into our stay). My husband loved the french toast and bacon he had every morning at the World Cafe breakfast too.
reviews.title: Another wonderful trip to secrets!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would go back in a heartbeat because of the great resort and wonderful people!!
reviews.title: SURVIVED HURRICANE SANDY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first time at an all inclusive resort and I don't think I can ever travel any other way! Beautiful views from every room. Christopher Brown was there to greet us, showed us our room and was there throughout our stay for anything we had questions about. Even getting my husband back to our room safely after getting lost lol Rodney at the Marlin Bar makes the best drinks and was very attentive to all his customers. Catamaran trip was beautiful...I believe Darren was our guide, and very informative. The French restaurant was among our favorites for dinner and wish we had tried the Seaside Grill for lunch earlier than our last day there. Jamaican Smile, Rum Punch, Mexican Dessert Shot and Big Bamboo were my preferred drinks. Barefoot Grille had a self tap beer for hubby. We did spend the extra for the Preferred Club, but didn't really see that it was worth it. We did get free wi-fi (which I barely used) and a soaking tub (not used at all). Our upgraded mini bar only consisted of 4 Red Stripe and a bottle of Brandy, Rum and Vodka. The lounge had an awesome open bar setup, though it seemed that anyone could frequent it. They never checked who was preferred or not. And the preferred St James was on the opposite side of the restaurants. The Bike tour was a neat little trip, just be sure to bring cash as they take you to a souvenier shop and juice bar. Well worth the money though. Just remember to be patient, they're not always in a hurry to get you things.Overall, great experience! I'd go back to Jamaica in a heart beat!
reviews.title: Great Views, Food and Booze

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I just returned from Secrets St. James on Saturday, 11/17. We had an absolutely wonderful trip and can not say enough about how great the resort is! In previous years we have stayed at Dreams Riviera in Riviera Maya and other all-inclusive resorts in Cancun. This has definitely been our favorite experience so far.
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Pros
reviews.title: Best Customer Service Combined with Complete Luxury

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: - The rooms were great. The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was perfect, and the view was magnificent.
reviews.title: "Resort was great!!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The food was excellent. Over a week's time, we had some great meals and some okay meals, but overall we really enjoyed all of the restaurants. Breakfast was great. (Make sure to bring pants as a man...they are actually strict about the dress code at the French and Mexican restaurants.)
reviews.title: EXCELLENT RESORT...you cannot go wrong here from a travel agent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right up front I'll say we really enjoyed our week at the resort. The property is beautiful and well-cared for. Since you're sharing services with Wild Orchid you basically have 8 restaurants, 5 pools and something like 8 bars at your disposal. We stayed in the preferred club. Well worth it in our opinion, but we're in our early 60's and liked the two private and quiet pools exclusively for our use. One was warm; one cool which was also pretty...cool! We had requested an upper floor (3rd) - I'd highly recommend same if you're doing the St. James Preferred because the views are better. They set up a nice little hot breakfast, lunch and appetizer set-up 18 hours or so a day with an amazing assortment of top shelf liquors. This may be important to some because most of the rest of the restaurants, including the really top notch World Cafe buffet are located on the Wild Orchid side and so are a 10 minute or so hoof away.
reviews.title: Great Face with a Few Blemishes

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach bars are two of the nicest I've ever seen. Swings and granite! I was almost afraid to get sand on 'em! Service was great and they had a wide variety of specialty drinks.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Restaurants were good; not great. Wait service in a few places was slow enough to cool the food sufficiently to make what would have made a great dish mediocre. Hard to say if that was a chef, waiter or management problem.
reviews.title: Great resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Entertainment was great! Shyam Moses (a Jamaican favorite of ours) was there 2 nights and the resorts's main stage, set against the hills of the mainland makes any performance extra special.
reviews.title: Anniversary Trip - Did we stay at the same place?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is pretty. As others have said, a bit rocky. If you're a tenderfoot, bring your water shoes. If the resort is full as it was during our stay, chairs fill, but there always seems like there's enough. Beach chairs here are wicker. Cool on the tush! And there are always a ton of towels. And cold bottle water bins - a great touch!
reviews.title: Excellent beachfront propertyy
